You are given a sequence of positive integers $t_1, t_2, ..., t_n$.  A sequence is considered "nice" if the following conditions are met:

*  $t_i < t_{i+1}$ for all odd $i < n$
*  $t_i > t_{i+1}$ for all even $i < n$

You can perform one swap of two elements in the sequence.  Find the number of ways to swap two elements so that the resulting sequence is "nice".

You are given a sequence of numbers.  You can swap any two numbers in the sequence exactly once.  Determine how many ways you can swap the numbers to make the sequence follow a specific pattern:  odd-indexed numbers must be increasing, and even-indexed numbers must be decreasing.
